Dear Thomas M. Scheuer:
Your license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable.
If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the license in the mail. Please review it for accuracy.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance in the following areas.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation in the following areas.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP for their interim inspection dated 1/24/2022. CAP was
approved on 2/14/2022. Agency was in violation with ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS and
ISEP 6.49 Medical Passports.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency received one safety alert.
Concern:
The relative has an above ground pool and they do not have necessary safety
items in place. There is no barrier around the pool, however the relative has a
locking ladder. There is no alarm on the door that provided direct access to
the pool.
Resolution:

Relative provider installed the door alarm on her back door on 11/8/2022. Video of
the alarm installed and working properly is attached to this alert and has been
uploaded to the most recent home evaluation. See alert for more information.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The CAA was reviewed and discussed via TEAM. The Chief Administrator reported the
Supervisor and staff were trained in their CAP after approval in 2022. The supervisor
and management team then met quarterly to discuss progress with their approved CAP.
Supervisors conducted special case reviews to ensure CAP compliance. The Director
reported there continues to be various challenges with key performance indicators due to
lingering issues related to COVID and families comfort level with face-to-face visits. He
reports in situations where staff departure is unexpected, it takes an extended amount of
time to hire and train for the vacant positions.
Interviews:
One licensing specialist and foster care specialist were interviewed. They both feel very
supportive by the agency and state their supervisors are very helpful. Overall, the
worker reported enjoying their jobs and not having any concerns about the agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
01/17/2023
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
01/17/2023
